website_summaries.verdict: For a bench model, the solid craftsmanship is impressive, but we wish all its components were as reliable.
pros: Works well for most minor to mid-level jobs and fits nicely in small workshops
Easy to assemble and maneuver – weighs less than 80 pounds
cons: Has a fence that can be difficult to adjust and a subpar dust port

customer_reviews.title: Defective, returned
customer_reviews.text: New to a jointer, I thought it was me. Right out of the box and my beautiful piece of walnut kept coming out with a couple of lines/grooves, like scratches, so I kept trying. Finally, looking at the 3 blades, I discovered one of them broken. There was a drip of metal underneath that blade that was not cleaned up after the roller head was created. This should not have passed inspection, and the person installing the blades would have noticed because attaching a blade that needs to sit flat would have been very difficult. Delta owes me for ruining a beautiful piece of wood! After planing, my 3/4" thick walnut is only 1/2", doesn't work for my project.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my small shop needs.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this bench top jointer for nearly a year. It's been used a fair amount in a small wood shop so I can fairly say it works well, adjustments are easy and hooking the dust port to a shop-vac really does help in keeping the dust level down.
customer_reviews.author: BJS, Bozeman, MT

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money.
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect! Nice solid feel. A bit heavy but the weight is a good thing, keeps it in place. Nice smooth feel and a good cut. You can use WD40 to get the shipping oil gunk off of it (a tip I got from Grizzly Industrial when I bought my metal working lathe) and then clean the WD40 off with a household cleaner. I just left the WD40 on it and kept cleaning it with paper towels until they came out clean.
customer_reviews.author: Bobn

customer_reviews.title: Delta 6” Jointer
customer_reviews.text: I am a mid level carpenter and I don’t always need the jointer but I wanted something reliable that I can pull out whenever I needed... this isn’t it..I bought this jointer about a year and a half ago.. it’s too loud, difficult to square, the blades don’t last at all and today started smoking from inside... In the time I owned this Delta garbage I used it a total of sixteen times and it burned out today... way over price and unreliable...
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: This works fine and came perfectly calibrated producing excellent jointing
customer_reviews.text: Years ago, I purchased the Delta jointer back when the indeed and outfield tables where made out of aluminum. They ended up warping, ruining the function of the machine (no replacement parts were available). So this time I sought out steel tables. This works fine and came perfectly calibrated producing excellent jointing. The only downside is weight. I have a small shop and have to move things around. This thing is heavy, but to me it's worth it. The set up manual is terrible with poor images, but I eventually figured it out. Delta needs a link to a you tube video.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, but I wouldn't buy it again
customer_reviews.text: Although it's pretty much solid steel, the build quality somehow seems extremely cheap. The bed, fence, blade and safety all seem perfect... but the rest of it is sketchy. There's a hand-turn key for locking the fence in place, using that key broke the fence support (which looked like 1/4" steel)... Way too brittle to be quality steel. I don't trust the cut depth crank... When you lower it, the knob gets very loose. I think it's causing inconsistent cuts due to the blade vibrations wiggling that knob.
customer_reviews.author: MadPete

customer_reviews.title: Good Tool for the Value
customer_reviews.text: Added this to my woodshop and love the usefulness of the tool. Set up took about 15 minutes and it is a little heavy, but I have been able to straighten out boards with ease. My only complaint is that the fence needs to be readjusted to keep it at a 90 degree angle. Make sure to have a good mechanics square to find that, but otherwise I recommend this tool
customer_reviews.author: adam

customer_reviews.title: tables not parallel
customer_reviews.text: YMMV - I took a chance on this jointer despite some of the reviews - I was on the lookout for chipped blades and got lucky on that front. However, after I assembled the unit and set the fence (using outfeed table as a reference), and tried jointing, I found that infeed and outfeed tables are not coplanar - the infeed table is almost one degree off relative to outfeed and the cutter. I can't see any insutrctions on how to adjust the table and make it coplanar to outfeed table and cutter, so this jointer is heading back and for $200 more, I'm getting a Grizzly 6x48 one.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Outfeed table is static, and not able to be adjusted. Infeed table adjustments were sloppy. When I finally got it coplanar, and knives perfect, I turn the machine on. The infeed table vibrates completely out of adjustment, comes in contact w/ the cutting head. Knives broken, infeed table broken at mounts, and back in the box for return.
customer_reviews.author: Josiah Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Item is faulty
customer_reviews.text: Bought the item unpackaged and setup. Item was turned on once for about one min then turned off. Went to turn it back on and item won’t turn on. Save your money and buy a better one you’ll thank yourself later.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: I was fortunate to grab this on discount. What a great jointer! I’ve used it 4 times now and each time I’m more impressed. Extremely happy with it. And, I especially like the cast fence. Other brands use aluminum for the fence, which doesn’t scream quality for me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Works okay but the metal fence cupped. I had to make a fence plate to get 90 degree angles.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: There are no instructions on how to solve this problem
customer_reviews.text: In feed table is not level, seems to be higher on fence side than outter side, having hard time getting it set up
customer_reviews.author: STEVE L JONES

customer_reviews.title: Broken Chip Exhaust
customer_reviews.text: A little disappointed with the packaging as it looks as though it had been dropped. As you can see the plastic is broken on the chip exhaust. Not enough for me to go through the effort of returning a 70 plus pound tool. Other than that it performed the task for which it was purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. A lot of good, solid cast iron. Adjustments to fence and table are easy. I bought this to replace an old, worn out Craftsman planer--should have done it years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Solid tool and a great shop joiner.
customer_reviews.text: Very solid and simple. The table and fence are machined very accurately. Does take some time to get the fence square and aligned, but once you do, it stays that way. Very simple to use. I use it for small to medium crafts and furniture. It helps make pallet wood join up perfectly (meticulously check for nails or staples when working with pallet wood). Has plenty of power to join up to a 2x6. Dust collection port works great and have it connected to a 5 hp Ridgid shop vac. It's also easy to change the blades if need be. Lives up to Delta quality and performance. I've very pleased with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: Its a good product.
customer_reviews.text: So far impressed. I believe its the best one for the price that you are going to find.
customer_reviews.author: Debi Creech

customer_reviews.title: Send me a new one I paid for
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new item received a scratched dusty used one
customer_reviews.author: Erhan

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: One of the screws which adjusts the cutting blade was tapped in the wrong location. Therefore the screw head does not fit into the slot on the cutting blade. During operation the blade slid outwards, striking the base plate edge. I am in the process of returning. Lowe's is the nearest authorized Delta rep.
customer_reviews.author: D. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Skip the reviews, low quality materials make inaccuracies!
customer_reviews.text: Cast iron fence piece was cracked when I got it. Split completely when I assembled per exact instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works very well and achieves a good standard of planed surface finish on a variety of ...
customer_reviews.text: It works very well and achieves a good standard of planed surface finish on a variety of hardwoods and softwoods. Shipping costs were expensive but I am pleased that I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for diy
customer_reviews.text: I can’t speak for everyone, but mine has held square since day one. Great addition to any garage workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Nice little tool
customer_reviews.text: It took only a little time to assemble. (The directions could have been more helpful, but if you have any skill with using tools it isn't too complicated.) I have used it for several projects and expect a lot of good use in the future. The price is affordable for a modest shop, and being a bench top tool, it doesn't take up too much space. Good deal!
customer_reviews.author: chuck

customer_reviews.title: Jointer
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with Jointer. Used it twice so far with great results.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Good for price
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and heavy, both table and fence are cast iron. Great for smaller items, but takes a lot of work and extra supports for larger pieces of wood.
customer_reviews.author: K. Williams

customer_reviews.title: the machining was not that good and I needed to get new parts for it
customer_reviews.text: the machining was not that good and I needed to get new parts for it. haven't been able to start using it yet.
customer_reviews.author: xteven holm

customer_reviews.title: A great planner
customer_reviews.text: Tricky to assemble but was able to do so. I’m very pleased! Excellent product

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Small Shop
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared to spend time on calibrating and setting up. Very solid performance for a hobbyist to enthusiast level woodworker.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey J Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Non-adjustable tables
customer_reviews.text: Infeed and outfeed tables came out of alignment (not coplanar) with no adjustment options. Support from Delta has been lackluster. Buy a different jointer.

customer_reviews.title: It's great for the price

customer_reviews.title: Not to happy with this jointer to begin with
customer_reviews.text: The knob came cracked, so amazon sending a replacement unit. Will be waiting to see how that unit is and will update this review
customer_reviews.author: debravue

customer_reviews.title: Need a replacement blade.
customer_reviews.text: The machine it's self seems all good and works fine. But it showed up with a nick in the blade that leaves a raised line in the flat surface of the wood. Can't seem to find a way to contact the manufacturer here to resolve the issue so I'm posting this comment. Otherwise it would receive 5 stars for the functionality of the machine. It works perfectly except for the nick in the blade upon arrival.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to square and hold true
customer_reviews.text: What a solid piece of equipment. Easy to square and hold true. Don't blow your back out trying to lug this by yourself.
customer_reviews.author: Noid

customer_reviews.title: Very nice quality, took about 45 minutes to set it ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice quality, took about 45 minutes to set it all up. Does a great job on cleaning up the surface of old wood.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this garbage. I had to return 2 back to back ...
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this garbage. I had to return 2 back to back because they arrived broken! Also, even if not broken, I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio R.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little guy
customer_reviews.text: It works for what it is. only reason I give it 4 stars is the fence mechanisms are a bit clunky feeling. Otherwise works great for a beginner like me.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra Davis

customer_reviews.title: Simple and solid.
customer_reviews.text: It's strong and heavy, does a good job. It took some tweaking to get the fence to stay square, but it seems ok now. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: James C.

customer_reviews.title: product arrived scratched and the plastic dust vent is all ...
customer_reviews.text: product arrived scratched and the plastic dust vent is all chipped up. The fence is a little hard to adjust but other then that it works quite well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good basic tool - not stellar
customer_reviews.text: Good basic tool - not stellar, but OK for the price. Best trick is to use a square to set the back fence to 90 degrees, then lock in place. Quick and accurate. No need to monkey with the stops.
customer_reviews.author: Neverland

customer_reviews.title: Not a good start!
customer_reviews.text: Not a good start!!! I am very disappointed with this jointer! I started to adjust the cutters and the second retaining screw head stripped out on the fist turn. Why would Delta put such cheap screws on their jointer? I am a machinist by trade .Fourty three years working with threads and such. Is there anything more frustrating than istripping out the head of a screw? I suppose... Not a good start!! Swap out those screws with a better grade steel.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: One Star

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. Buy a big boys machine. You will spend more time trying to get the fence to be square that it will drive you crazy. Not to mention the plastic dust port was broken and cracked upon delivery. All in all I ordered a new shop size machine.

customer_reviews.title: Solid Tool
customer_reviews.text: Had a bit of trouble getting the fence at a perfect 90 degrees. After that, works great. I've run several kinds of wood on it, hard to harder for segmented bowl turning. The weight of the cast iron makes it stable.
